properties.popup-text:
Fountain of the Godsmongers
This fountain sits at the center of six shrines to the six disciples of Caltolav known as the Godsmongers.

The Little Market
A collection of small booths and display areas available for rent by the day, week or month for asporint tradespersons or crafters to display their wares.

Athear of Justice
Dedicated to Szalavalar (Map location B.7)

Abyssal Claw
The location of the Abyssal Claw that was used by Mezrek during the Abyssal Rending to invade Merisyl.

Eilendere Trade Consortium Tradehouse
This merchant house is primarily comprised of Elvish traders.

The Cheese Hut
Specializing in cheeses of all sorts.

Fallen Treasures
Pawn shop.  Owned and operated by Menk Tornwing

Kerowyn's Money Exchange
A moneychanger’s office and home.

Medalain Hall
An inn commonly used as a gathering spot for political campaigning.

Endless Festival
The nearby temple to Haryxmi has established these large buildings as venues for all sorts of entertainment, from music to plays to dancing and more. True to its name, it is never closed and never empty.

City Council Complex
Collects taxes and tribute on behalf of the city council.

Athear of the Hopeful Dawn
Dedicated to no specific God or Goddess, but instead the concept that Death waits for all living things, and thus is a powerful force deserving of worship.

Wind Rider
Leatherworker specializing in saddles and riding gear.  Includes exotic items such as harnesses for riding dragons and rocs.

Magisterium
The offices, training grounds and compound of the city magistrates.

Sage's Guild
A loosely-organized guild of historians, researchers and others driven by a quest of knowledge.

Craftsman's Guild
An organization dedicated to ensuring that tradesmen are fairly treated by the merchant consortiums of the city.

Holy Fen of Vivlorean
A temple dedicated to  Vivlorean, the Korthjach Goddess of life, death, rebirth and renewal.

Athear of the Brass
A temple dedicated to Haryxmi

Athear of the Forge
A temple dedicated to Ator

Athear of the Deep
A temple dedicated to Khirr

Athear of the Bounty
A temple dedicated to Premyzic

Athear of Night
Dedicated to the dark side of human nature rather than any specific Deity, this temple celebrates hedonistic pleasures, vices and forbidden desires.  Always in conflict with the Athear of Justice and frequently in conflict with the Athear of Trade, the financial power of the Athear of Night gives them significant sway in the city.

Athear of Trade
A temple dedicated to Caltolav

Athear of the Duality
A temple dedicated to Endrell

Athear of the Ninefold
This Athear is dedicated to the concept of balance, and the importance of avoiding extremes.  Devoted primarily to philosophical musings on this topic, they tend to accumulate the least wealth – and therefore wield the least power.  Their patron Goddess is Nuvria.

Athear of Hate
A temple dedicated to Zelagiur

Temple of Humanity
This is a temple dedicated not to any deity, but to the concept that the strength and ability of non-draconic races is significant and meaningful, and should be appreciated and celebrated.   Its members are known as the Order of Humanity.

Lake Verrisima
This deligntful park is a common destination for those who seek a brief respite from the bustle of Aodar.

Tzantor's Broadsheets
Fegrin Tzantor and a small staff produce a weekly newsheet with a modest but dedicated readership.

Council Exchange
The Council Exchange is the building in which all legislative activity for the city takes place.

Tavrix Ulcha
Draconic for “Violet Tower”, this 8 story tower is the home of the mage known as “The Father”.

Mistress Capachic's Home for Children
Mistress Capachic runs an orphanage supported by wealthy donors. She is both a skilled caretaker and a skilled fundraiser.

Cold Truth
A daily paper run by Saolo Deronda, a former member of a major merchant house. The paper is a forum for nurturing their many grudges.

Meyville's Tannery
Cures and tans leather for use by tailors, armorers, etc.

Thickstitched
Gon Thickstitch creates and sells finely crafted leather goods.

Cresting Wave
An upscale tavern that caters to the patrons of the nearby tournament grounds.

The Empty Boot Camp
A quiet tavern which caters primarily to Magistrates.

Plaza of the Grand Caravan
A small but well-known open-air marketplace. To attract customers they make a weekly
of their restocking from the Aodar docks, with musicians, entertainers, and candies for the children.

Dawnbreak
This inn offers a spectacular sunrise view, and one of the most highly touted breakfasts in the city.

Coral Crest
This inn/tavern is one of the most expensive in the Free City, catering to the movers and shakers of the city.

The Tippler's Top
A cozy tavern offering hearty fare, fine drinks, and tales of adventure.

Brother Camtor's
The drinks and service here are mediocre, but the outdoor seating and Brother Camtor's riveting tales keep business high.

Museum of the Winds of Trade
A tribute to the naval and trade history of Aodar, with historical artifacts from the early days of various trade houses and shipping companies.

Sensate Emperium
An expensive establishment specializing in sensory experiences. Patrons might visit to indulge in luxurious baths infused with magical oils, partake in exquisite feasts that tantalize all five senses, or even undergo enchantments that heighten their perception of the world around them. It is a place where the boundaries between reality and fantasy blur, offering an escape from the mundane into a realm of heightened sensations.

Unshekvir (“Noble Horse”)
Unshekvir offers boarding for horses, and rental of horses.

The Black Unicorn
This inn caters primarily to Dwarven customers.

Fergal's Finest
The docks, offices and fishing piers of Fergal's Finest, one of the premier fisheries on the island.

Lanthwip's House Broker
Lanthwip specializes in facilitating the sale and purchase of homes.

Tack-n-Harness
Saddles, bridles and all other horse related equipment.
Embassy of the Protectorate of the Black Wyrm

Sandwiches and Meat Pies
The name says it all...

Gallery of the Gifted
A collection of booths and display areas for the artists (and those who fancy themselves talented) to display their works for purchase.

Sails and Canvas
Sales, canvas, and other ship-related goods.

Wagon maker
Makes wagons, carts, cart wheels and the like.

The Ale Bringer
A cooper, the proprietor Vandy Precarious, believes that he does the world a great service by providing a means for ale to be brought from one place to another.  To celebrate his contribution he partakes heavily of ale.

Bell Tower
A 12-story belltower.  The city road runs through the first two stories.

Mishka's House
Home of Mishka, daughter of an academic specializing in the study of the Pacantryx.

Jenlyn's House
Jenlyn is a Kobold bartender at the Medelain Hall.

Home of Wharven Kelsbedder
A single-story house with a large basement, this is where Wharven Kelsbedder has made his residence.

Bale of Ale
The shopkeeper, Kailen Tapper, has been known to sell minor poisons.

Petrov Estate
This is the Estate of the powerful caster Alvyx Petrov.

The Lucky River
Seedy tavern which fronts high-stakes poker games

Vem the Verminator
Wildlife removal services & pest control.

Forever Friends
Taxidermy shop run by Cabzel Porlune

Medelain Hall
Popular hangout of the River of True Blood

Arcavictorious
This spot is popular with the locals, who enjoy the tall tales told by the proprietor, Arkavix (a Tamgol) and the band of former adventurers he's attracted as regular patrons.
